-1.title: We've Been Through It All
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Flop House Flip
1.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a house and turns out a nightmare flip.

2.title: Spanish Style Salvage
2.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa rescue a Spanish home in a historic district.

3.title: Vandalized Foreclosure
3.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa purchase a vandalized home in Anaheim Hills.

4.title: Underwater Flip
4.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa gamble on a home that has water damage.

5.title: Double Trouble Flip
5.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a home and discover it needs an overhaul.

6.title: The Bungalow Gamble
6.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa invest in a 1920's bungalow with a studio.

7.title: A Flip with a View
7.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa hope to flip a hilltop home with a view.

8.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses
8.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa remodel a home to mirror the one next door.

9.title: Facelift Flip
9.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a short sale home and give it a facelift.

10.title: The Moldy Mess
10.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa try to flip a home but find toxic mold.

11.title: Awkward Floor Plan
11.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a home with an awkward floor plan.

12.title: Inland Empire Cosmetic Nightmare
12.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a cosmetic eyesore outside their areas.

13.title: The Foreclosure Heebie-Jeebies
13.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa buy a home at auction to flip for profit.

1.title: Foreclosure Shock
1.plot: With no foreclosures to flip in Orange County, Tarek and Christina broaden their search to include Los Angeles County and find a house with a view that looks promising. The only problem is that the home is too far away for them to look at it before they go to the auction, so they'll have to bid on the property sight unseen. After placing the winning bid, they meet their contractor at the house for a design walk-through. But listing photos aren't always what they appear, and the divide between initial perception and present reality has left Tarek and Christina in total...

2.title: Hard Money Blues
2.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a listing in an upscale neighborhood of Whittier, California and although the home will need some serious updating from its original 1969 finishes, the renovation appears to be mostly cosmetic.

3.title: Nothing But Potential
3.plot: Tarek and Christina find a bank-owned listing which has been on the market for less than 24 hrs and is only accepting offers until 5pm that same day. It's a house with great potential, so they make an offer and the bank accepts.

4.title: Too Small to Fail
4.plot: Tarek and Christina find a short sale home listed in Whittier, CA that's rather small but the asking price looks enticing. Despite their rigid debt ceiling, they're convinced they can buy and rehab the home within a strict budget.

5.title: Dirty, Dated and Undesired
5.plot: Tarek and Christina spot a home listing online that's set for auction and based on neighborhood comps, the dirty and dated house looks like a bargain. By outward appearances, all it needs is an inexpensive cosmetic rehab.

6.title: Unfinished Flip
6.plot: Tarek and Christina are contacted by a cash strapped flipper who needs to unload a project house. He's willing to sell the home in as is condition for $315,000 cash.

7.title: Flipper vs. Flipper
7.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a short sale listing in Anaheim Hills that has just fallen out of escrow. The large home shows promise and with a heftier-than-usual price tag, Tarek and Christina will need financial help.

8.title: A Barnyard Dance
8.plot: Tarek and Christina find an intriguing short sale in desirable Torrance neighborhood. The exterior's in good shape and the comparable properties are a good value; but after touring the home, it's clear it needs a lot of work.

9.title: Loud, Louder, Loudest
9.plot: Christina gets an e-mail from an agent with a listing in Hawthorne. The dated house needs work and while it's on a busy street near an airport and a noisy elementary school, it's the list price that draws in Tarek and Christina.

10.title: A Neglected Flip
10.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a home in Anaheim, CA, that's being offered as a quick sale with no inspections or contingencies. Seems like a great project, but with a tenant, they can't see inside before making an offer.

11.title: Hilltop Hangup
11.plot: Tarek and Christina come across a short sale listing in a desirable La Mirada, CA. Its price leaves a tighter profit margin than they would like, but the 1990s home is newer than the properties they typically buy.

12.title: Ranch House of Ruin
12.plot: Tarek and Christina come across a trust sale listing in Buena Park, CA that looks very well-priced in comparison to recent sales in the area. After receiving a preliminary estimate, they're excited by the potential for profit.

13.title: A Risky Flip
13.plot: Tarek and Christina spot a listing that seems too good to be true and the house doesn't exactly match the potential it had in the listing. But even with a major surprise, Tarek and Christina still see an opportunity for profit.

14.title: Mid-Century Flip
14.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa get a lead on a home in Long Beach, CA, that sounds like the kind of project that has become their standard. But soon after a walk-thru, it becomes clear that this flip is anything but standard.

1.title: Cracked Flip
1.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa come across a listing for a newer home in Yorba Linda, California that has great potential but has seen better days. The owner is motivated to sell quickly which could yield an enticing deal.

2.title: Custom Craftsman
2.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa are contacted by their friend and fellow flipper, Jessie Rodriguez, who has purchased a craftsman style home in an historic area of Santa Ana, CA.

3.title: Abandoned Flip
3.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa get a lead on a short sale property in Long Beach, CA that looks like a promising investment project, save for one small issue: the massive renovations the previous owners began are only partly finished.

4.title: Toxic Flip
4.plot: A small, neglected house in Garden Grove, CA, could hold rags or riches.

5.title: Junk Yard Flip
5.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa spot an interesting property in Long Beach. It's a very small house and because the house is currently tenant-occupied, they will have to make their buying decision without inspecting the property.

6.title: Pipe Dreams
6.plot: A dream flip in Garden Grove, California is in danger of going down the tubes.

7.title: Freeway Flip
7.plot: Tarek and Christina take a risk on flipping a historic home in Anaheim, California.

8.title: No Risk, No Reward
8.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a trust sale property in Anaheim. It's in good shape and seems like a mostly cosmetic project with a lot of potential. But, they begin to wonder if this home has more potential than pitfalls.

9.title: Too Good to Be True
9.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa find a clean house in good shape that's aggressively priced in comparison to comparable properties in the area. It appears as good as advertised. They quickly make an offer to snatch up this flip.

10.title: A Flip with the Enemy
10.plot: Tarek and Christina are busier than ever with their growing business. As a result, when a fellow flipper contacts them about partnering on a house and he wants to split the time, money, and profit 50/50, they are very interested.

11.title: Big Lot, Little Flip
11.plot: Tarek and Christina try to flip a little house on a large lot in Buena Park, California.

12.title: The Money Pit
12.plot: Tarek and Christina El Moussa find a listing in Norwalk, California with such an attractive opportunity for profit based on comparable properties that they immediately make an offer on the property, sight unseen.

13.title: Thrifty vs. Glitzy
13.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa are contacted by friend and investor, Pete de Best. Pete has found a newer construction home in Orange, California that needs cosmetic updating and should prove to be a fast, simple flip.

14.title: A Dinky Flip
14.plot: Tarek and Christina el Moussa get a lead on a small and outdated property in Downey, California that has potential to be a fast, cosmetic flip. Tarek believes the reward will outweigh the risk and they buy the property.

15.title: A Pig in a Poke
15.plot: Tarek and Christina spot a trust sale in Fullerton, California that could either spell treasure trove or money pit.

16.title: Abort Flip
16.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a promising deal in Long Beach, California. However, the property is currently tenant-occupied so they can't inspect the inside of the house.

1.title: Of Wreck and Ruin
1.plot: Tarek and Christina spot a tenant-occupied home in rough shape in La Puente, CA. If they can get it for the right price, it could pay off big time. Can they right this sinking flip or could this home turn out to be wreck and ruin?

2.title: Fun House Flip
2.plot: Tarek and Christina acquire a short sale in Anaheim, California, with a puzzling maze of barricaded windows and suspicious additions. They'll have to stay on budget to turn this tricky fun house into a functional family home.

3.title: Diamond in the Rough
3.plot: Tarek and Christina find a small home in a desirable neighborhood in Costa Mesa, CA. Can they transform this house from the worst on the block to the showpiece by the beach?

4.title: Big Money Flip
4.plot: Tarek and Christina look into restoring a midcentury modern home in Costa Mesa, CA. It's more expensive than their usual projects and the renovation could get pricey. Can they turn a big-money profit from this big-money flip?

5.title: Breaking Up
5.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a home in Torrance, CA, with foundation issues. Torrance is an exploding market and the land value alone could make this flip worth the risk. Can they transform this difficult home and make a profit?

6.title: Trickle Down Flip
6.plot: Tarek and Christina tackle a rundown and overgrown home in Chino, California. Recent area sales show potential for profit, but right away they uncover serious water damage. Will Tarek and Christina turn a profit on this flip?

7.title: Boxed in Flip
7.plot: Tarek and Christina scope out a house in Fullerton, CA, that shows some potential for profit. Will they be able to unpack this cramped floor plan or have they backed themselves into a corner on this boxed-in flip?

8.title: Natural Disaster
8.plot: Tarek and Christina pair up with an investor to score a house in a gated neighborhood. Expensive flips can mean large returns, but they also take more time. Will they score their biggest profit yet or lose it all?

9.title: Dilapidated Flip
9.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a property in Santa Ana, CA, that could be both a great entry-level family home and a profitable flip. It's clear this run-down home needs a lot of work. Can they bring the project in on time and on budget?

10.title: A Frantic Fiasco
10.plot: Tarek and Christina flip a mid-century home with a dream layout in Placentia, CA. Can they overcome surprises and setbacks to survive this frantic fiasco?

11.title: Million Dollar Flip
11.plot: Tarek and Christina take on their most expensive flip in an upscale part of Yorba Linda, CA. Can they give this house the luxury treatment without busting their budget?

12.title: Pesky Flip
12.plot: Tarek and Christina encounter hidden problems and untimely mistakes while renovating an old home in Santa Ana, California.

13.title: House of Hidden Horrors
13.plot: Tarek and Christina head to La Habra, CA, to check out an enticing off-market listing. Can they transform this house into a dream home or could a nightmare renovation spell flop for this house of hidden horrors?

14.title: A Family Friendly Flip
14.plot: Tarek and Christina receive a call from their longtime friend Carlos, who needs some help flipping his family's house. Can they safely mix friendship and business to turn a profit on this family-friendly flip?

1.title: Down to the Studs
1.plot: Tarek and Christina take on a Whittier, CA, home that would scare most buyers away, but as renovation begins, the expenses keep piling up. Will costly problems bring this house and their profit down to the studs?

2.title: Cat Nip Flip
2.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a house sight unseen in La Palma, CA. Can they make a profit on a house with only the unknown lurking behind the front door?

3.title: Old Tim Flip
3.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a turn-of-the-century home in a historic Santa Ana, CA, neighborhood. Can Tarek and Christina handle the issues that come along with renovating an old home or will ancient issues come back to haunt them?

4.title: Communal Flip
4.plot: Tarek and Christina flip the worst home on the block in this Anaheim Hills neighborhood. With high profit margins in a desirable neighborhood, this should be a slam dunk. But will a the strict HOA hold up this communal flip?

5.title: Fire Sale Flip
5.plot: Tarek and Christina get a hot tip on a great deal for a '60s single story home in Costa Mesa, CA. Once work starts on the home, they immediately run into big ticket issues. Will their profits burn up in this fire sale flip?

6.title: New Flips, Familiar Faces
6.plot: With Christina on bed rest, Tarek enlists his business partner to help him land a great deal on a run-down house in Corona, CA. Will these old friends be able to work together or will Christina's absence spell disaster?

7.title: Labor of Love
7.plot: Tarek and Christina get a good lead on home in Fullerton, CA, but upon arrival they see the house is riddled with cracks. Will they rebuild the foundation or watch as their profits disappear into this quicksand flip?

8.title: Split at the Seams
8.plot: Tarek and Christina take on a much needed makeover on a house in Torrance, California, but they're concerned about its cracked foundation and walls.

9.title: Hidden Potential
9.plot: Tarek and Christina have their work cut out for them on a Garden Grove, CA, home. Not only is the house on a busy street, it's a mess. Has the couple opened up a can of worms or does this flip have potential waiting to be found?

10.title: Substitute Flop
10.plot: Tarek's friend Pete contacts him about a house in La Habra, CA. Christina is busy with new addition Brayden, so Tarek and Pete team up to tackle this project. Can the duo pull it off or will problems sink this substitute flip?

11.title: Narrow Margin Flip
11.plot: A friend of Tarek and Christina's purchases a property in Anaheim, CA, and wants to bring them in for the flip. But as renovation begins, the budget estimate goes out the window and the property looks less like a good buy.

12.title: Fast Money Flip
12.plot: Tarek and Christina check out a home with a tight profit margin. The house is in good shape and it shouldn't take much time or money to flip. Will it be smooth sailing or will setbacks threaten this fast-money project?

13.title: Beached Bungalow
13.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a bungalow on the edge of a historic Long Beach, CA, neighborhood. Christina loves the period details and design while Tarek loves that the good condition of the interior could mean savings in the budget.

14.title: Doll House Flip
14.plot: Tarek and Christina are contacted by a homeowner in Garden Grove, CA, about a house they want to sell quickly. The house needs a lot of work and has strange rooms which could be disastrous when trying to get permits.

15.title: Midcentury Miss
15.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a midcentury house in La Habra, CA. The margin is tight so they need to get in and out quickly to maximize profits. Will they be able to nail the design or will this home be a midentury miss?

1.title: Beach Side Beauty
1.plot: Tarek and Christina find a home in Torrance, CA, that's close to the ocean and several upscale beach communities. With a million dollar listing price in mind, can they keep a lid on their budget or will their profits wash away?

2.title: Split-Level Falls
2.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a split-level home in Long Beach, California. Can Tarek and Christina create a backyard beauty by the beach, or could design woes push them over the edge of this split-level falls?

3.title: Backyard Staycation
3.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a home in Riverside, CA, with a massive backyard. There's potential to make this the biggest backyard transformation ever, but it won't be cheap and they risk spending more than they can get back.

4.title: Pooling Value
4.plot: Tarek and Christina find a large home in the desirable town of Cypress, CA. They know they can make money on this flip, but adding a pool could bring even bigger returns. Can they get top dollar or will hiccups dry up the profit?

5.title: Poolside Potential
5.plot: Tarek and Christina are on the hunt for a summer project and find a unique home in Whittier, CA. The house has potential to be an entertainer's paradise, but the couple faces risks with the depressed pool and large backyard.

6.title: Addition and Subtraction
6.plot: Tarek and Christina take on a fixer-upper in Garden Grove, California, with a small floor plan but a large yard for expansion. Could an addition be the perfect solution or will it just end up subtracting from their profits?

7.title: Double Lot Limbo
7.plot: Tarek and Christina have big plans for a Buena Park, CA, home that could potentially bring in a large extra profit. But a strange layout and permit issues could set the project back.

8.title: Ready-to-Flip Ranch
8.plot: Tarek and Christina snatch up a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom house in Anaheim for an easy flip, but they discover one bathroom is only a half bath that doesn't meet code. Will they have to lose a bathroom and some profit along with it?

9.title: Hot Market, Fast Flip
9.plot: Tarek and Christina get a quick flip in an up-and-coming neighborhood in Garden Grove, California, but unpredictable problems threaten to douse this smoking deal.

10.title: Wishful Workshop
10.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a home in Garden Grove, CA, that has a large workshop addition that could appeal to buyers. Will the addition help sell this home or will permit issues cause too many problems?

11.title: Lessons in Laguna Beach
11.plot: Tarek and Christina find a small house in an upscale neighborhood in Laguna Beach, CA. They learn it's overpriced and put in an offer well below the asking price, stunning the seller, but will the offer still be considered?

12.title: Diving Into a Flip
12.plot: Tarek and Christina simultaneously flip a home in Anaheim, CA, and remodel their own backyard. Will they be able to handle two big remodels at the same time, or have they thrown themselves into the deep end with too many projects?

13.title: Hillside Horror
13.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a small home that could sell for over $1 million in Palos Verdes, CA. Can they turn this hillside horror into a high-class home, or are they in over their heads in this beachside community?

14.title: False Start Flip
14.plot: Tarek and Christina get a good deal on a dirty home in El Monte, CA. Will they be able to keep costs to a minimum and maximize their profit, or did they jump the gun on this false-start flip?

15.title: Beaming with Potential
15.plot: Tarek and Christina buy a four-bedroom home beaming with potential in Cypress, CA. When they discover the ceiling isn't supported correctly, the home could end up costing them more than they expected.

1.title: A Deceiving Deal
1.plot: Tarek and Christina uncover some unpleasant surprises after buying a tenant-occupied home in Whittier, CA.

2.title: Switching Rooms
2.plot: Tarek and Christina get lead on a four-bedroom home with a strange layout in Garden Grove, CA.

3.title: Post-Purchase Problems
3.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a large and partially renovated home in Anaheim, CA. Is this house a flipper's dream home or are the structural issues the first of many problems to come?

4.title: Midcentury Maze
4.plot: Tarek and Christina attempt to pull off the perfect flip when they pick up a dirty but charming home in Garden Grove, CA.

5.title: Infringing Flip
5.plot: A seller is looking to offload a three-bedroom, two-bathroom home in Garden Grove, CA. The home already has an open floor plan, but an extra bedroom with an illegal permit might drain any potential profit.

6.title: Junk-Pile Flip
6.plot: Tarek and Christina flip a small home with big problems in Long Beach, CA. From the front door to the garage, what seems like a great home is actually a junk pile filled to the brim with hidden obstacles.

7.title: Shattered Flip
7.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a four bedroom, two bathroom home in Lakewood, CA. Their hopes of a great deal in a good neighborhood are shattered, however, when they discover that the dilapidated house has been vandalized.

8.title: Midcentury Markup
8.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a Santa Ana, CA, home with midcentury architectural details that could sell for top dollar. However, when they go to buy the house, they're forced to outbid other investors.

9.title: Pigeonhole Flip
9.plot: Tarek and Christina take on a home that's full of surprises in Santa Ana, California. They work to modernize the house as much as possible to appeal to the modern-day buyer, but with every challenge comes more problems.

10.title: What's Old is New Again
10.plot: Tarek and Christina get a lead on a home in Hacienda Heights, California, where they find some outdated designs and others that are in-style once again.

11.title: Rock Bottom Flip
11.plot: Tarek and Christina get a good lead on a 1500 sq. ft. house in Whittier, CA. The home is dirty and dated, with a large fireplace in the center that will cost a fortune to update.

12.title: Two Houses For Sale
12.plot: Tarek gets a lead on a house in Buena Park, CA, but it needs more work than they'd hoped. Meanwhile, Christina struggles to tell Tarek she wants to sell the house they lived in for fear of sending their flip off the rails.

13.title: Flipping and Dating
13.plot: Tarek and Christina make plans to view a property in Diamond Bar, CA. But when Tarek rushes off for a date, Christina relentlessly pokes fun at him, and a blowout between them could get in the way of making a profit.

14.title: Bursting at the Seams
14.plot: Tarek and Christina are out of town when they get a lead on a house in La Mirada, CA, so they buy the house sight unseen. Christina worries the house is packed with problems, but Tarek believes big risks come with big rewards.

15.title: Tri-Level Flip
15.plot: Tarek and Christina flip a four-bedroom, tri-level home in Orange, CA, with a pool full of problems and a dated interior floor plan.

16.title: New Normal in Arcadia
16.plot: Tarek and Christina flip a large home in the unfamiliar neighborhood of Arcadia, CA, but their differing opinions threaten their profit margin in an area with a high market standard.

17.title: Dark and Dingy
17.plot: Tarek and Christina find a good flip in Garden, CA, but Christina is worried that Tarek's penny-pinching will prevent them from making the necessary design decisions to maximize profits.

18.title: Rotten Flip
18.plot: Tarek and Christina take a gamble on a million-dollar possibility in Anaheim Hills, CA. Issues with dry-rot and mold complicate the flip.

19.title: Fantastic Flip
19.plot: Tarek and Christina take on a home in a trendy Costa Mesa, CA, neighborhood but if they want to give the hip home buyers what they want, they'll first have to nail the design.

20.title: Infested Flip
20.plot: In the season 7 finale, Tarek and Christina land on a small three-bedroom, two-bathroom home that needs a lot of work in Santa Ana, California. Once they get inside, they realize it needs more love than they expected.

imdb.plot outline: Real estate agents Tarek and Christina flip houses in Southern California by purchasing old homes in need of TLC and renovating them to perfection. The couple re-sells the houses for a profit, breaks even, or loses money. Follow the flips from purchase through re-sell, and provides the viewer with all of the information in-between.
imdb.title: Flip or Flop
plot: Real estate agents Tarek and Christina flip houses in Southern California by purchasing old homes in need of TLC and renovating them to perfection. The couple re-sells the houses for a profit, breaks even, or loses money. Follow the flips from purchase through re-sell, and provides the viewer with all of the information in-between.

Real estate agents Tarek and Christina flip foreclosures, short sales, and bank-owned properties. They pay for the houses in cash, sometimes, sight-unseen. Some of the houses are easy fixes, but others are total tear-downs; flipping houses is a risky business.
